DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to a classification of adverse events that grades complications according to the treatment that is induced to treat the complication. The classification is designed to eliminate subjective interpretation of serious adverse events and tendency to down-rate complications, being based on data that is usually well documented and easy to verify. It is also well suited for retrospective analyses.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A classification of adverse events that grades complications according to the treatment that is induced to treat the complication. The classification is designed to eliminate subjective interpretation of serious adverse events and tendency to down-rate complications, being based on data that is usually well documented and easy to verify. It is also well suited for retrospective analyses.

Concepts.definition: A classification of adverse events that grades complications according to the treatment that is induced to treat the complication. The classification is designed to eliminate subjective interpretation of serious adverse events and tendency to down-rate complications, being based on data that is usually well documented and easy to verify. Property.preferredDefinition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

Concepts.definition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A classification of adverse events that grades complications according to the treatment that is induced to treat the complication. The classification is designed to eliminate subjective interpretation of serious adverse events and tendency to down-rate complications, being based on data that is usually well documented and easy to verify. It is also well suited for retrospective analyses.

PermissibleValues.value: Grade I: Any deviation from the normal postoperative course without the need for pharmacological treatment or surgical, endoscopic, and radiological interventions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any deviation from the normal postoperative course without the need for pharmacological treatment or surgical, endoscopic, and radiological interventions.

Concepts.definition: Any deviation from the normal postoperative course without the need for pharmacological treatment or surgical, endoscopic, and radiological interventions.

PermissibleValues.value: Grade IIIa: Requiring surgical, endoscopic or radiological intervention. (Intervention not under general anesthesia.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An intervention not under general anaesthesia.

Concepts.definition: A complication requiring intervention not under general anesthesia.

PermissibleValues.value: Grade II: Requiring pharmacological treatment with drug other than such allowed for Grade I complications.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A complication requiring pharmacological treatment with drug other than such allowed for Grade I complications.

Concepts.definition: A complication requiring pharmacological treatment with drug other than such allowed for Grade I complications.

PermissibleValues.value: Grade IVa: Life threatening complication (Single organ dysfunction.)
Grade IVb: Life threatening complication (Multiorgan dysfunction.)
Grade V: Death of a patient.
Grade IIIb: Requiring surgical, endoscopic or radiological intervention. (Intervention under general anesthesia.)

Concepts.definition: A complication requiring intervention under general anesthesia.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.
